intro: Cryptantha jamesii var. laxa, commonly known as the lax flowered cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
